data.title: CURLING NORVEGE - SUISSE MESSIEURS - VANCOUVER 2010 - 10.02.19
data.summary: * Vancouver : 20100219, défaite de l'équipe nationale de Suisse de curling, qui a battu la Norvège sur le score de 7 à 4, lors d'un match de la 5e session du tour préliminaire messieurs des jeux olympiques d'hiver de Vancouver 2010.

sequences.summary: Vancouver : divers plans match de curling entre l' équipe nationale de  Suisse composée de STOECKLI, Ralph, HAUSER, Jan, EGGLER, Markus, STRUEBIN,  Simon et MUELLER, Toni et l'équipe de Norvège composée de ULSRUD, Thomas,  NERGAARD, Torger, SVAE, Christoffer, PETERSSON, Haavard Vad et LOEVOLD, Thomas (37"). curling, messieurs, Jeux olympiques d'hiver.

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 19 – 19.02.10 
 

MENU 
    

TIME PICTURE;SOUND  COMMENTARY 
    

0.40 KARIM BENZEMA 
(FRENCH) 

 

HELLO, I’M KARIM BENZEMA; WELCOME TO THE UEFA 
MAGAZINE SHOW.  

    

0.46 MD7 footage 
Beckham goal v Real 
Madrid for Man United 
Benzema goal v  Man 
United for Lyon 

 This week, the Champions League really gets down to business, 
as two of football’s biggest stars take on the clubs that made them 
great. 
 

    

0.54 Beckham press conference 
Stadium exteriors  
Match edit shots 

 We’re with David Beckham, ahead of Milan’s versus Manchester 
United.  
 

    

0.58 DAVID BECKHAM 
(ENGLISH) 

 

PROBABLY THE FIRST TIME THAT I’M GOING TO WANT 
MANCHESTER UNITED TO LOSE. 

    

1.02 Benzema b-roll 
Benzema goal v AC Milan 

 And we speak to the prodigal son of Lyon, Karim Benzema, back 
in France for the first time as a Galáctico.   

    

1.10 MD7 footage   Plus the best of the rest of the action, as the knockout stage kicks 
off in style. 

    

1.15   End 
    

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 19 – 19.02.10 
 

DAVID BECKHAM FEATURE 
 

   

TIME PICTURE;SOUND  COMMENTARY 
 

   

1.16 Map to Milan  So first to the world’s most famous footballer who’s reacquainting 
himself with some old friends. 

 

   

1.23 Beckham montage 
including shots from 
adverts + shots as a child + 
Man U goal + celeb 

 He was born in East London in May 1975 – his father a kitchen 
fitter; his mother a hairdresser – both fanatical Manchester United 
supporters. And despite growing up in the capital – there was only 
ever going to be one English club for David Beckham. 

 

   

1.40 DAVID BECKHAM 
(ENGLISH) 
 

Beckham action for Man 
United 

 FOR ME PERSONALLY IT’S AN EMOTIONAL TIME BECAUSE 
YOU KNOW I’VE NEVER PLAYED AGAINST MANCHESTER 
UNITED BUT AS A MANCHESTER UNITED FAN IT’S 
PROBABLY THE FIRST TIME I’M GOING TO WANT 
MANCHESTER UNITED TO LOSE. I ALWAYS EXPECTED TO 
BE AT MANCHESTER UNITED MY WHOLE CAREER.   

 

   

1.59 1999 final montage  Beckham’s European highlight came at the Nou camp 11 years 
ago – and that incredible last gasp win over Bayern Munich. 

 

   

2.07 DAVID BECKHAM 
(ENGLISH) 
 

1999 final celebs + 
Ferguson shots 
 

2008 final celeb shots 

 

‘99 OF COURSE WE HAD AN INCREDIBLE YEAR WE WON 
THE TREBLE, THE CHAMPIONS LEAGUE WHICH IS SO 
IMPORTANT TO MANY CLUBS BUT MANCHESTER UNITED 
ARE ALWAYS GOING TO BE A STRONG TEAM NO MATTER 
WHAT, BECAUSE SIR ALEX FERGUSON IS A MANAGER 
THAT ALWAYS LOOKS TO IMPROVE THE TEAM AND HE 
DOES THAT ALL THE TIME. HE AMAZES MANY PEOPLE BUT 
THE PLAYERS AND THE PEOPLE THAT HAVE BEEN 
AROUND HIM, IT DOESN’T AMAZE YOU ANY MORE 
BECAUSE YOU KNOW THE TALENT HE HAS GOT AND YOU 
KNOW THE PASSION HE HAS GOT FOR THE GAME AND 
FOR MANCHESTER UNITED. 

 

   

2.36 Beckham celebrity shots + 
MU goal Real + newspaper 
headlines 

 But a rising profile off the pitch put Beckham at odds with his 
manager. And a dressing room row meant he was on his way to 
Real Madrid. 

    

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 19 – 19.02.10 
 

2.47 DAVID BECKHAM 
(ENGLISH) 
 

Photo of Beckham with 
Ferguson as a child 
 

Beckham action for Man 
United 

SIR ALEX FERGUSON WAS ALWAYS A FATHER FIGURE TO 
ME ALWAYS HAS BEEN AND ALWAYS WILL BE, NO 
MATTER WHAT PEOPLE HAVE SAID IN THE PAST ABOUT 
OUR RELATIONSHIP WHETHER WE HAVE GOOD TIMES OR 
BAD TIMES, FOR ME THE ONLY TIMES I REMEMBER ARE 
THE GOOD TIMES. HE WAS THE MAN THAT GAVE ME MY 
CHANCE TO PLAY FOR A CLUB THAT I’D ALWAYS 
DREAMED OF PLAYING FOR. OF COURSE, AS AN AC MILAN 
PLAYER WE WANT TO WIN THIS TIE , I WANT TO BEAT 
MANCHESTER UNITED AND TO SAY THAT AS A 
MANCHESTER UNITED FAN IS QUITE DIFFICULT. 

 

   

3.16 Alex Ferguson shots plus 
press conference shots 

 Unsurprisingly, it didn’t take the massed ranks of the Press long 
to bring up the Beckham factor. 

 

   

3.22 ALEX FERGUSON 
(ENGLISH) 

 THAT WAS THREE SECONDS 
 

    

3.25 ALEX FERGUSON 
(ENGLISH) 
 

Beckham in England shirt 
Beckham action for Real 
Madrid 
 

 

I THINK DAVID HAS GREAT EXPERIENCE, THAT’S WHAT HE 
HAS – HIS EXPERIENCES.  HE’S GOT 100 AND SOMETHING 
CAPS WITH ENGLAND, HES PLAYED FOR AC MILAN, HE’S 
PLAYED FOR REAL MADRID, HE’S PLAYED FOR 
MANCHESTER UNITED.  IT’S SIMILAR TO OTHER AC MILAN 
PLAYERS LIKE SEEDORF, PIRLO, AMBROSINI AND NESTA 
THEY ALL HAVE FANTASTIC EXPERIENCE, INZAGI IS 
GREAT EXPERIENCE TO HAVE GOING INTO BIG GAMES. 
THAT’S WHAT DAVID WILL BRING. 

 

 

 

 

3.48 LA GVs + airport shot in 
Milan outfit 

 It’s Beckham’s second loan spell at Milan from the LA Galaxy – 
but there was never any question he’d be welcome back. 

    

3.55 LEONARDO 
(ENGLISH) 

 I THINK HE IS A VERY SMART GUY, A VERY POLITE GUY 
AND HE’S AN INCREDIBLE PLAYER.   

    

3.59 LEONARDO 
(ENGLISH) 

 I ASKED HIM ABOUT THE POSSIBILITY OF COMING HERE. 
IT WAS MY CHOICE. WITH HIS EXPERIENCE AND 
CHARISMA THAT’S WHY HE IS HERE. 

    

4.06 LEONARDO 
(ENGLISH) 

 IS THAT OKAY (WHISPERS) 

 

   

    



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 19 – 19.02.10 
 

4.07 DAVID BECKHAM 
(ENGLISH) 

THANK YOU VERY MUCH - I’LL HAVE TO GIVE HIM SOME 
MONEY AFTER. 

    

4.12 LEONARDO 
(ENGLISH) 

 HE WROTE SOMETHING BEFORE I AM JUST READING IT, I 
AM JUST READING IT. 

 

   

4.16 AC Milan v Man United old 
action 
Kaka and Ronaldo shots 

 The last time these two sides met in the Champion’s League, 
Milan came out on top over the two legs. But since then the 
personnel on both sides have changed: and the two biggest stars 
have gone to Real Madrid. 

    

4.30 DAVID BECKHAM 
(ENGLISH) 
Kaka Ronaldo Madrid shots 
Carrick goal MD2 
Milan goal v Madrid MD3 

 I THINK WHENEVER ANY CLUB LOSES PLAYERS LIKE 
RONALDO AND KAKA THERE IS ALWAYS A DIFFERENCE 
BECAUSE THEY ARE SUCH GREAT PLAYERS, TWO OF THE 
BEST PLAYERS IN THE WORLD BUT YOU CAN SEE WITH 
THE WAY MANCHESTER UNITED ARE PERFORMING THAT 
THEY ARE DOING VERY WELL THIS SEASON AND OF 
COURSE YOU CAN SEE WITH THE WAY AC MILAN HAVE 
BEEN PERFORMING – BIG CLUBS ALWAYS LOSE BIG 
PLAYERS AND ITS ABOUT GETTING OVER THAT AND ITS 
ABOUT MOVING ON. 

 

   

4.57 DAVID BECKHAM 
(ENGLISH) 
MU 09/10 montage 
 

 MANCHESTER UNITED ARE A GREAT TEAM THEY’VE GOT 
GREAT PLAYERS, ALL THE WAY THROUGH THEIR TEAM 
THEY’RE STRONG, THEY PASS THE BALL WELL, THEY 
KEEP THE BALL AND WITH WAYNE ROONEY IN THE FORM 
THAT HE’S IN HE’S DIFFICULT TO STOP – SO WE KNOW 
THAT WE HAVE TO PLAY WELL. 

    

5.11 LEONARDO 
(ENGLISH) 

 BUT DON’T WORRY I THINK ABOUT THAT 

    

5.15 DAVID BECKHAM 
(ENGLISH) 
Beckham goal for Madrid 
Beckham goal for MU 

 OBVIOUSLY I WOULD BE PLEASED TO SCORE  AND IF I DO 
THEN IT WOULD BE AMAZING BUT I THINK FOR MY 
RESPECT TO MANCHESTER UNITED AND TO THE FANS I 
WOULDN’T CELEBRATE BUT I WOULDN’T ALSO WANT THE 
MILAN FANS TO THINK THAT I AM NOT EXCITED TO BE 
SCORING WHICH OBVIOUSLY I WILL BE BUT I THINK OUT 
OF RESPECT I WOULDN’T CELEBRATE  

    

 

 

 

 

 

 

 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 19 – 19.02.10 
 

5.38 DAVID BECKHAM 
(ENGLISH) 
Beckham celebs for MU 

TO BE PART OF MANCHESTER UNITED TEAM THAT 
PLAYED IN THE CHAMPIONS LEAGUE FOR MANY YEARS 
AND ALSO NOW TO BE PART OF AN ACMILAN TEAM THE 
HISTORY GOES BEYOND ANYTHING YOU COULD EVER 
DREAM OF AS A FOOTBALL PLAYER SO TO BE PART OF 
THIS TIE IS SPECIAL. 

    

5.54   End 
    

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 19 – 19.02.10 
 

MILAN V MAN UNITED MATCH FEATURE 
    

TIME PICTURE;SOUND  COMMENTARY 
    

5.55 Fan shots outside stadium  As the 80,000 fans began to fill the San Siro one name was on 
everyone’s lips – facing his former club where it all began. 

 

 

 

 

6.04 MILAN FANS 
(ITALIAN) 

 

BECKHAM, HE’S A GREAT PLAYER. 

 

 

 

 

6.06 MILAN FANS 
(ITALIAN) 

 

FORZA MILAN  

  

 

 

6.08 MAN UNITED FANS 
(ENGLISH) 

 

I QUITE LIKE HIM, I WISH HE PLAYED FOR MAN U. 

 

   

6.10 MILAN FANS 
(ITALIAN) 

 

I THINK HE’LL FEEL VERY EMOTIONAL.  WE’LL HAVE TO 
SEE WHAT HE DOES ON THE PITCH. 

 

   

6.14 MAN UNITED FANS 
(ENGLISH) 

 

COME ON UNITED 

    

6.15 MAN UNITED FANS 
(ENGLISH) 

 

HE’LL GET A GREAT RECEPTION FROM ALL THE 
MANCHESTER UNITED FANS THAT HAVE COME TO MILAN 
TONIGHT. 

 

   

6.20 MILAN FANS 
(ITALIAN) 

 

HE’LL DEFINITELY HAVE A GREAT GAME. 

 

   

6.23 MAN UNITED FANS 
(ENGLISH) 

 

I LOVE DAVID BECKHAM. 

 

   

6.24 MAN UNITED FANS 
(ENGLISH) 

 

I HOPE SOMEONE TACKLES HIM HARD. 

 

   

6.26 MILAN FANS 
(ITALIAN) 

 

HE’S A GREAT CHAMPION. 

 

   

6.28 MAN UNITED FANS 
(ENGLISH) 

 

HOPE HE PLAYS TONIGHT BUT I HOPE HE DOESN’T 
SCORE. 

    

    



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 19 – 19.02.10 
 

6.31 Flag inside stadium, 
Beckham warm ups, few of 
the locals chanting, teams 
out, Capello, Beckham and 
Rooney and fan shot. 

So the stage was set for two of Europe’s heavyweights to lock 
horns. The locals anticipated a high quality match.  And with 
some big names watching on, surely the action on the field 
wouldn’t disappoint…  

    

6.45 Kick off, Pato fouled by 
Evra, from resulting free 
kick United’s clearance is 
volleyed home by 
Ronaldinho, celebrations 
from players and crowd. 

 Milan were first out of the blocks, a sprightly Pato proved hard to 
contain for Patrice Evra. As all eyes turned to Beckham a 
trademark free kick brought about a goal – with a little help from 
Evra, Ronaldinho had rocked the reds….. 

    

7.01 Ronaldinho trick, reaction, 
Leonardo. 

 Leonardo had urged his charges to be flawless ahead of the 
game, the Brazilian wasn’t disappointing his manager. 

    

7.08 Wasted cross Nani, 
Rooney reacts. 

 If Ronaldinho was enjoying the endless supply Wayne Rooney’s 
was falling short. 

    

7.13 Tackle Bonera on Park.  United were being pegged back at every opportunity. 
    

7.18 Huntelaar shoots wide, Van 
der Sar reacts. Ferguson, 

 Klaas Jan Huntelaar who’s been linked with a move to United was 
taking advantage of defensive errors - Edwin Van Der Sar was 
seeing red, his manager wasn’t enjoying what he was seeing. 

    

7.28 Fletcher crosses for 
Scholes goal, celebrations. 

 But that would soon change – Paul Scholes somehow mistimed 
his volley to perfection…..for United’s first goal against Milan at 
the San Siro. 

    

7.38 Ronaldinho skill and strike 
into half time. 

 The hosts were still causing problems for United – Ronaldinho 
was tireless but chances were spurned and would soon be 
regretted.  

    

7.47 Flag, second half kick off,  As the referee blew up for half time - Sir Alex was sure to do the 
same in the dressing room – The catalogue of errors needed re-
writing. 

    

7.56 Ronaldinho fouled by 
Carrick for yellow card. 

 But Michael Carrick began the second half with his own 
misfortune……and that would be compounded later 

    

 

 

 

 

  

 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 19 – 19.02.10 
 

8.07 Valencia replaces Nani Change was needed as Nani made way for Antonio Valencia and 
his presence made all the difference, as Rooney was about to 
steal all the limelight. 

    

8.17 Manchester United score 
through Rooney, 
celebrations  
 

 Scholes again in the mix for this time the Ecuadorian to provide 
more impetus to Rooney – the inch perfect cross – gave him his 
24th goal of the season - a personal record for any campaign and 
suddenly United were invigorated   

    

8.32 Beckham substituted 
Rooney just wide with shot 
Anxious Milan fans 

 Rapturous support from the travelling fans accompanied 
Beckham’s departure but they would soon be making even more 
noise for one of their own. 

    

8.40 Rooney scores again for 
Manchester United, set up 
by Fletcher, celebrations, 
fans 

 As United’s early set back looked a distant memory less than ten 
minutes after his first, Rooney grabbed his second – Darren 
Fletcher was left in plenty of space for the 24 year old to easily 
nod past Dida – no chance against that one. 

    

8.56 Seedorf goal set up by 
Ronaldinho, fans react and 
Seedorf celebration 

 Some had seen enough but Milan wouldn’t give in.  Their midfield 
hadn’t ran out of steam just yet. Ronaldinho was controlling the 
flanks yet again, for substitute Clarence Seedorf to prove he still 
has what it takes at 33.  

    

9.15 Inzaghi set up by 
Ronaldinho, smashes ball 
wide. 

 And had Filippo Inzaghi capitalised on his team-mates relentless 
energy it could have been a better ending for the hosts. 

    

9.25 Pato is fouled, Carrick kicks 
ball away, second yellow 
card and then red card. 

 But that certainly wouldn’t be the case for Carrick – accused of 
slowing the game down, he’ll now miss the second leg at Old 
Trafford  

    

9.37 Free kick Pirlo, United 
clear, Becks watches on, 
full time whistle.  
Rooney applauds 
Manchester United fans. 

 Time had finally run out for Milan, the Beckham fanfare had been 
somewhat over shadowed – with 3 away goals Sir Alex could now 
reflect on a job well done and one man would certainly earn 
praise from his manager.  

    

9.53 WAYNE ROONEY 
(ENGLISH) 

 

IT WAS ALWAYS GOING TO BE A DIFFICULT GAME 
TONIGHT ESPECIALLY GOING 1-0 DOWN EARLY ON, AND 
TO COME BACK AND WIN 3-2 WAS A GREAT RESULT FOR 
US IN THE END. 

  

 

 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 19 – 19.02.10 
 

10.00 DAVID BECKHAM 
(ENGLISH) 
 

Rooney scores with 
celebrations 

 

I THINK IN THE FIRST HALF WE PLAYED REALLY WELL, IF 
WE HAD GOT THE CHANCES PUT THE CHANCES AWAY 
THAT WE HAD THEN IT MIGHT HAVE BEEN A DIFFERENT 
GAME.  BUT YOU GIVE MANCHESTER UNITED AND WAYNE 
ROONEY CHANCES HE’LL SCORE. 

 

 

 

 

10.13 LEONARDO 
(ENGLISH) 
Beckham applauds crowd 

 

IT’LL BE TOUGH, BUT I THINK IT LEAVES EVERYTHING 
OPEN; I DON’T THINK WINNING 2-0 AT OLD TRAFFORD IS 
SO IMPOSSIBLE.  

    

10.20   End 
    

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 19 – 19.02.10 
 

PORTO V ARSENAL 
    

TIME PICTURE;SOUND  COMMENTARY 
    

10.21 MATCH IDENT  NOSCRIPT 
    

10.24 Varela goal  Arsenal coach Arsene Wenger was without five first team regulars 
– including goalkeeper Manuel Almunia. His deputy, Lukasz 
Fabianski, had a nightmare start – fumbling Varela’s intended 
cross over the line only 11 minutes in. 

    

10.37 Campbell goal  But the Gunners were soon level. Sol Campbell scoring in 
successive Champions League games – albeit almost four years 
apart after the 206 Final. 

    

10.47 Fabianski picking up ball 
Falcao goal 

 The big talking point came early in the second half after Swedish 
referee Martin Hansson penalised Fabianski for picking up 
Campbell’s back pass. And as Arsenal switched off the quick 
thinking Ruben Micael teed up Radamel Falcao for the winner. 
The Columbian’s 18th of the season – and it keeps the tie on a 
knife-edge ahead for the return leg in London. 

    

11.08   End 
    

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 19 – 19.02.10 
 

TEASE 
    

TIME PICTURE;SOUND  COMMENTARY 
    

11.09 COMING UP STING  NO SCRIPT 
    

11.14 Benzema B-Roll 
Benzema Match Edit 
Footage 

 Coming up after the break - Karim Benzema on coming home to 
Lyon. 
 

 

    

11.19 Goals and Action from 
Teams playing in the 2nd 
round of 1st Leg Matches 
Jose Mourhino Close Up 

 And we look ahead to the next round of 1st leg matches, including 
a big night for the special one.   
 

    

11.24   End 
    

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 19 – 19.02.10 
 

WELCOME BACK 
    

TIME PICTURE;SOUND  COMMENTARY 
    

0.05 MILAN FANS 
(ITALIAN) 

 

WELCOME BACK TO THE CHAMPIONS LEAGUE 

    

0.08 Various fans  NO SCRIPT 
    

0.18 CHILD FANS 
(ENGLISH) 

 WELCOME BACK TO THE CHAMPIONS LEAGUE 

    

0.19   End 
    

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 19 – 19.02.10 
 

BENZEMA FEATURE 
    

TIME PICTURE:SOUND  COMMENTARY 
  

  

0.20 Map to Madrid  Next to Madrid, where Real’s 1st leg tie with Lyon was causing 
something of a stir for one particular player. 

  

  

0.28 Crowd noise 
Benzema Lyon goal celeb 

 NO SCRIPT 

  

  

0.32 Benzema scoring for Lyon 
Benzema signs for Real 
Madrid 
Benzema IV set ups 

 He came to prominence at Olympic Lyonnais but last summer 
Karim Benzema swapped France for Spain transferring to Real 
Madrid.  And the French international can’t wait to face his old 
team mates. 

 

   

0.44 KARIM BENZEMA 
(FRENCH) 
 

 BEFORE THE DRAW I WAS TALKING TO SOME OF THE 
LYON PLAYERS, JUST FOR A LAUGH I WAS SAYING, ‘I 
HOPE WE GET LYON’,  AND THEN AS SOON AS I SAW THE 
DRAW AND WE WERE AGAINST LYON, I WAS SHOCKED, 
AND I SAID TO MYSELF, IT’S HAPPENED. BUT…  I’M 
REALLY HAPPY TO BE PLAYING AGAINST LYON. 

    

1.03 KARIM BENZEMA 
(FRENCH) 
Lyons goals + celebs 
against Liverpool MD3 

 THEIR STRONG POINTS ARE THAT… FOR EXAMPLE, THEY 
CAN BE PLAYING BADLY, AND THEN ALL OF A SUDDEN, 
JUST LIKE THAT, THEY PLAY A FANTASTIC GAME. IT 
OFTEN HAPPENS WHEN THEY PLAY A HUGE TEAM, THEY 
RAISE THEIR GAME TO THE OPPOSITIONS LEVEL, OR EVEN 
GO BEYOND IT, THEY SURPASS THEMSELVES ON THE 
PITCH AND PLAY A GREAT GAME, AND THAT’S HOW 
THEY’VE MANAGED TO GET SO MANY GREAT RESULTS 
AGAINST THE REALLY BIG TEAMS, ESPECIALLY AT THE 
GERLAND. 

    

1.27 KARIM BENZEMA 
(FRENCH) 
Benzema goals for Lyon 

 IT’S GOING TO FEEL WEIRD, BECAUSE I SCORED LOTS OF 
GOALS AT THE GERLAND, I GREW UP THERE. ALL MY 
FRIENDS AND FAMILY ARE THERE, AND THEY’LL BE AT 
THE MATCH. BUT NOW I PLAY FOR REAL MADRID, SO 
ONCE I’M ON THE PITCH, I’M GOING TO HAVE TO SCORE, 
EVEN THOUGH IT’LL BE HARD, BUT I’LL JUST HAVE TO 
SHUT IT OUT, TRY AND FORGET ABOUT IT, IN ORDER TO 
CONCENTRATE, AND PLAY A GOOD MATCH. 

    

 

 

 

 

  

 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 19 – 19.02.10 
 

1.48 Benzema goals for Lyon A prolific scorer both domestically and in Europe the Frenchman 
is well versed in the art of goal celebration.  But what if he scores 
against Lyon? 

    

2.00 KARIM BENZEMA 
(FRENCH) 

 I WON’T CELEBRATE THE GOAL. I’LL KEEP CALM; I HOPE 
THAT I’LL SCORE BUT I WON’T CELEBRATE IF I DO.  

    

2.08 KARIM BENZEMA 
(FRENCH) 
Lyon goalkeeper Lloris 
montage 

 LLORIS IS A GREAT KEEPER AND HE MAKES SOME GREAT 
SAVES. I THINK THAT IF HE’S ON FORM IT’LL BE DIFFICULT 
TO SCORE AGAINST HIM. LAST YEAR I USED TO PLAY 
WITH HIM IN TRAINING AND I SAW HE’S A REALLY GOOD 
KEEPER. 

 

   

2.23 KARIM BENZEMA 
(FRENCH) 

 I WAS AT LYON FROM 9 TILL I WAS 21, SO I DID 
EVERYTHING OVER THERE, AND IF I’VE GOT TO THIS 
LEVEL NOW, IT’S THANKS TO OLYMPIQUE LYONNAIS.  

    

2.32 KARIM BENZEMA 
(FRENCH) 
Benzema in action for Lyon  
celebrating with fans 

 I GREW UP THERE; IT WAS THROUGH THEM THAT I GOT TO 
KNOW DIFFERENT PLACES IN EUROPE, AND THAT I GOT 
TO GO AND PLAY FOR A BIG CLUB LIKE REAL MADRID. 
THE FANS ARE FANTASTIC; AND THEY LOVE ME.  

 

   

2.44 Benzema in action for Real 
Madrid 

 His high profile move not only meant a new set of fans to impress 
but a new language, new culture and a whole new level of 
pressure … 

    

2.51 KARIM BENZEMA 
(FRENCH) 
Benzema in action for Real 
Madrid 

 I FEEL GOOD. A LOT BETTER THAN I DID, BECAUSE AT THE 
START, I’D NEVER BEEN TRANSFERRED BEFORE, I’D 
NEVER LEFT MY FAMILY, SO I WAS LIVING ALL ALONE IN A 
CITY WHERE I DIDN’T SPEAK THE LANGUAGE, BUT NOW I 
UNDERSTAND EVERYTHING AND I SPEAK A BIT MORE 
SPANISH, BUT IT’S ALWAYS TOUGH AT THE START, 
THOUGH I THINK I’VE PLAYED SOME GOOD GAMES, AND I 
HOPE IT’LL GET BETTER AND BETTER.  

    

3.13 KARIM BENZEMA 
(FRENCH) 
Benzema in action for Real 
Madrid 
 

 IT’S TRUE, THERE’S ALWAYS PRESSURE, THERE’S 
ALWAYS HUGE PRESSURE ON EVERY GAME, AROUND THE 
PLAYERS, IN ALL THE PAPERS IT’S ALWAYS ‘REAL 
MADRID, REAL MADRID’, THE PRESSURE ON THE PLAYERS 
IS MASSIVE. 

    

    



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 19 – 19.02.10 
 

3.34 KARIM BENZEMA 
(FRENCH) 
Benzema in action for Real 
Madrid 
Kaka goal plus stadium 
celeb shots 

THIS YEAR, IT’S TRUE, THE FINAL IS AT THE BERNABEU, 
OUR HOME GROUND. IT’S A GREAT THING FOR US, AS WE 
ALL WANT TO PLAY THE FINAL AT HOME; THAT WOULD BE 
SOMETHING FANTASTIC.  IT’S A CRAZY STADIUM.  A BIG 
STADIUM THAT ALWAYS HAS LOTS OF PEOPLE IN IT, IT’S 
JUST BRILLIANT.  

 

   

3.49 Benzema scoring for 
Madrid 

 And he’s certainly settled in well at the Bernabeu and at just 22 
years of age, Benzema’s got his eye on a number of trophies. 

    

3.59 KARIM BENZEMA 
(FRENCH) 
Autograph shots + 
Benzema in Madrid colours 

 TO HAVE A REALLY GREAT CAREER, TO WIN EVERYTHING 
– THE WORLD CUP, THE EUROPEAN CHAMPIONSHIP, THE 
LEAGUES IN WHICH I’M PLAYING, ONE DAY THE BALLON 
D’OR, TO WIN EVERYTHING, WHEN I WAS REALLY SMALL I 
WANTED TO BE A PROFESSIONAL FOOTBALLER, NOW IT’S 
ALL ABOUT WINNING EVERYTHING. 

    

4.19   End 
    

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 19 – 19.02.10 
 

LYON V REAL MADRID MATCH FEATURE 
 

 

 

 

TIME PICTURE;SOUND  COMMENTARY 
    

4.20 MATCH IDENT  NO SCRIPT 
 

 

 

 

4.23 Lyon signage. 
Fan colour outside ground 
from both sides. 
Zinedine Zidane arriving at 
ground. 
Karim Benzema arrives at 
ground. 

 It’s barely seven months since Lyon’s favourite son departed to 
join the second influx of Galácticos at the Bernabeu. And with a 
certain sense of inevitability, Benzema’s new side Real were 
drawn to face his old club. His welcome was always going to be a 
warm one – he helped the club win the domestic title four times in 
as many years in French football. 

 

 

 

 

4.44 LYON CHILD FAN 
(FRENCH) 

 

VIVE LYON! 

  

 

 

4.46 VOX POP 1 
(FRENCH)  
Lyon fan  

 

YES, BENZEMA’S BACK, IT’LL BE SPECIAL FOR HIM.  

 

   

4.51 VOX POP 2 
(FRENCH)  
Lyon fan 

 

WE MISS HIM A LOT. THERE’S A BIG GAP SINCE HE LEFT.  

 

   

4.55 VOX POP 1 
(FRENCH)  
Lyon fan 

 

TONIGHT HE’S AN ENEMY, BUT HE’S STILL A LYONNAIS.  

    

4.59 Lyon fans inside ground. 
Benzema pre match. 
Lyon players warming up. 

 Although the Lyon fans were clearly excited to see the return of 
their prodigal son; his presence was a stark reminder that the club 
are now habitually selling on their prize assets. 

    

5.09 VOX POP 2 
(FRENCH)  
Lyon fan Lyon players 
warming up. 

 

THERE ARE NO MORE BIG STARS AT LYON. LOTS OF NEW 
PLAYERS HAVE ARRIVED. BUT THEY’VE NOT DONE SO 
WELL. THE GOOD YEARS HAVE GONE NOW. I THINK WE’RE 
IN TRANSITION BETWEEN 2 TEAMS. 

  

 

 

5.20 WILLY MAISONNASSE 
(FRENCH)  
Lyon players warming up 
Lisandro on big screen 

 

THE END OF A CYCLE? NO. IT’S THE START OF A NEW 
CYCLE. THE TEAM IS IN TOTAL RECONSTRUCTION. BUT 
THE LYON OF THIS SEASON ARE PERHAPS LESS STRONG 
THAN LAST SEASON. 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 19 – 19.02.10 
 

5.32 Benzema in tunnel pre 
match. 
Benzema walking out  

 So there was almost tangible relief around the ground when the 
line-ups were announced. Benzema, troubled of late by a groin 
injury, would start on the bench. 

    

5.40 Teams out. 
Lyon fan shots. 
Kick off. 

 Lyon coach Claude Puel described the game as “the start of an 
adventure”. But it looked like being a dangerous one – Real came 
into the match just two points behind Barcelona in La Liga. 

    

5.50 Real players being 
dispossessed. 

 Early on though the Spanish superstars failed to reproduce the 
eye-catching pass-and-move football they’ve been showing back 
home.  

    

5.57 Govou shot over 
 

 And Lyon carved out the game’s first genuine chance for Sidney 
Govou – the striker a survivor of two victories over Real at the 
Stade Gerland. 

    

6.06 Grenaro shot comfortably 
saved 

 At the other end it was powder-puff stuff from the nine-time 
European champions – Granero and co well below par. 

    

6.12 Marcelo booked 
 

 And it got worse – Marcelo was booked and will now miss the 
second leg in Spain.  

    

6.17 Fans jumping   Lyon were growing in confidence and the home fans knew it. 
    

6.20 Delgado hits the post  Just before the break Cesar Delgado connected perfectly on the 
volley – it shook the post…and noticeably Real’s confidence too. 

    

6.29 Half Time whistle  0-0 at half-time – but no question Real had ridden their luck. 
    

6.33 Makoun goal 
 

 Not for much longer – 90 seconds after the restart Jean Makoun 
ran right at the heart of a retreating defence…and finished with a 
flourish.   

    

6.42 Celebs  Delirium for the locals, you’d have thought they’d won the trophy 
itself. 

    

6.50 Benzema on sideline  Although one Frenchman cut a rather more forlorn figure. 
    

6.53 Lisandro shot wide. 
 

 Real looked in a state of shock – Lisandro agonisingly close to 
doubling the lead. 

    

    



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 19 – 19.02.10 
 

6.58 Ronaldo shot well saved 
Lloris 

Then, finally, Real stirred from their slumber, it had taken an hour. 
Ronaldo brought the best out of Hugo Lloris. 

    

7.04 Higuain shot saved Lloris  Then the national number one produced more heroics to deny 
Gonzalo Higuain. 

    

7.10 Benzema comes on  It was the striker last contribution – cue a huge ovation for the 
man of the moment. 

    

7.16 Benzema sets up Ronaldo 
who shoots wide  

 And Benzema was straight into the action – but the 
French/Portuguese alliance hadn’t quite clicked. 

    

7.24 Benzema shot saved.  Benzema scored 43 goals in a Lyon shirt – just one against them 
tonight would have been priceless.  

    

7.32 Ramos header over  Sergio Ramos flashed a header just over the top. 
    

7.36 Scoreboard  But time was running out for Real… 
    

7.41 Ronaldo shot saved 
Full Time celebs 
 

 One last hurrah from Ronaldo – but Lloris had earned his clean 
sheet. And Lyon their victory – Real in serious danger of 
elimination at this stage for the sixth straight season…they’ll have 
to be far, far better at the Bernabeu. 

    

7.56 RONALDO  
(SPANISH) 

 

WELL IT CAN HAPPEN IN FOOTBALL, ESPECIALLY AS IT IS 
DIFFICULT TO PLAY AWAY MATCHES IN THE CHAMPIONS 
LEAGUE BUT WE HAVE TO REMAIN POSITIVE, AS WE ARE 
GOING TO PLAY AT HOME AND WE WILL HAVE TO WIN. 

 

   

8.06 HUGO LLORIS 
(FRENCH) 

 

WE MANAGED TO HANG ONTO THE RESULT, AND EVEN 
THOUGH WE COULDN’T GET A SECOND GOAL WE CAN 
DEFINITELY BE VERY HAPPY.  IT’S VERY GOOD FOR US, 
FOR THE SUPPORTERS, FOR THE CLUB.  BUT THERE’S 
STILL THE AWAY LEG AND THAT’LL DEFINITELY BE VERY 
COMPLICATED.  

    

8.20   End 
    

 

 

 

 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 19 – 19.02.10 
 

BAYERN v FIORENTINA 
    

TIME PICTURE;SOUND  COMMENTARY 
    

8.21 MATCH IDENT  NO SCRIPT 
    

8.24 Gomez disallowed goal 
Robben penalty 

 Dutchman Arjen Robben was causing problems for the visitors - 
Franck Ribery was brought down but Mario Gomez tucked away 
the goal it didn’t stand though as Referee Tom Henning Ovrebo 
had already blown up.  Robben happily put away the resulting 
penalty 

    

8.41 Koldrup goal  But Fiorentina were in confident mood having won their last 5 
matches in the tournament and Per Koldrup grabbed the all 
important away goal. 

    

8.49 Gobbi red card  A clumsy challenge on Robben saw Massimo Gobbi take his 
leave in the 73rd minute. But despite the man advantage it was 
Bayern who scored another 

    

9.00 Klose goal  Robben’s blast was parried by Sebastian Frey…..but Miroslav 
Klose managed to seize his first of the competition. Cries for off-
side went unheard as the hosts take a slender advantage to 
Tuscany. 

    

9.14   End 
    

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 19 – 19.02.10 
 

ONE TO WATCH – INTER V CHELSEA 
    

TIME PICTURE:SOUND  COMMENTARY 
    

9.15 PREVIEWS MAP + ONE 
TO WATCH STING 

 Looking ahead now, there are 4 more first leg ties still to come. 
And as far as reunions go, none can match the “special one” Jose 
Mourinho, up against his old club. Inter v Chelsea, our one to 
watch. 

    

9.27 Mourinho animated close 
ups at Inter, and running 
onto the pitch at Chelsea 

 He’s become accustomed to highly charged matches in the 
Champions League, so to be drawn against Chelsea, came as no 
surprise to the Special One. 

    

9.35 JOSE MOURINHO 
(ENGLISH) 

 

I ALWAYS GET MY EX- TEAM. WHEN I WAS AT CHELSEA I 
PLAYED 2 OR 3 TIMES AGAINST PORTO, I PLAYED 3 TIMES 
AGAINST BARCELONA, I CAME TO INTER I GET 
IMMEDIATELY BARCELONA AGAIN, SO CHELSEA WAS THE 
MISSING LINK. 

    

9.53 Mourinho and Lampard 
celeb, plus cu at Inter and 
Inter flags. Gerrard goal 
and celeb 07/08 v Inter. 
Ronaldo goal and celeb 
08/09 v Inter 

 Mourinho’s on an incredible run – having lost just one home game 
in 8 years. But Inter’s recent form against English clubs isn’t 
great. Crashing out to Liverpool two years ago, and in Mourinho’s 
first season in charge, Manchester United put paid to them. 

    

10.10 Chelsea feet and flags. 
Anelka goal and celeb. 
Ancelotti cus and celebs at 
Milan. 

 Chelsea travel to Milan having breezed through the knockout 
stage unbeaten. It’ll be a quick return to the San Siro for Carlo 
Ancelotti, who spent 8 years calling the stadium home, as boss of 
Milan, in which time he lead Inter’s city rivals to Champions 
League glory in 2003 and 2007.   

    

10.28 Ancelotti ca, Ashely Cole 
sad cu. Zhirkov set up 
Drogba goal and celeb 

 But Ancelotti preparations have been rocked by Ashley Cole’s 
ankle injury, which has ruled him out for the foreseeable future. 
The Londoners will now look to summer signing Yuri Zhirkov to fill 
in at left back.  

    

10.40 Mourinho runs onto pitch 
celebs. Ancelotti cu and 
celeb 

 So will it be Jose, or will it be Carlo – it’s a tie to savour. 
 

    

10.45   End 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 19 – 19.02.10 
 

MATCH PREVIEWS 
    

TIME  PICTURE;SOUND  COMMENTARY 
    

10.46 Gross close up, Stuttgart 3 
goals and celebs v Unirea. 

 Stuttgart’s win against Unirea in their final group game saw them 
seal qualification, and a glamour tie with Champions Barcelona. 

    

10.54 Iniesta goal and celeb v 
Chelsea. Xavi celeb v 
Chelsea and B roll shots 

 The Germans are big underdogs with Barca unbeaten in their last 
9 Champions League away matches. But the Catalans will be 
without the influential Xavi, who has been ruled out by injury. 

    

11.07 CSKA training x 2. Zico and 
Ramos close ups. Slutski at 
training and match cu. 
CSKA goal and celeb v 
Man U. 

 Zico and Juande Ramos had been and gone at CSKA before new 
boss Leonid Slutski led his team into the knockout round for the 
first time in their history.  
 

    

11.17 Alves pen miss v 
Fenerbache 08. Sevilla 
skills and Kanoute goal 

 Sevilla lost to Fenerbahce on penalties at this stage two seasons 
ago, but having comfortably qualified from their group, they are 
slight favourites to progress further this time.   

    

11.29 Zico close ups at 
Olympiacos. Olympiacos 
goal and celeb 
 

 Zico was also dismissed by Olympiacos in January, despite 
leading the Greeks to only their third appearance at this stage of 
the competition. 

    

11.38 Bordeaux goals and 
celebs. Blanc cu, Bordeaux 
skills and celeb. 

 Their opponents Bordeaux are this years form team. Laurent 
Blanc’s side have dropped just two points in their 6 matches so 
far, and conceded only 2 goals. 

    

11.49   End 
    

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 19 – 19.02.10 
 

CLOSER 
    

TIME  PICTURE;SOUND  COMMENTARY 
    

11.50 Hleb B roll and close ups  That’s all for this week…next time the reunions continue, as we 
talk to the on-loan star with a point to prove - Stuttgart’s Alexsandr 
Hleb - ahead of taking on his parent club Barcelona. 

    

12.03 Blanc b roll and close ups 
Bordeaux goal 

 And we’re with Laurent Blanc, whose Bordeaux team are proving 
to be this years surprise package 

    

12.08 Blanc b roll  See you next week… 
    

12.10   End

scripts:
2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 1 

2010 FIFA WORLD CUP™ MAGAZINE 

EPISODE 13 
Play-out 12 February 2010; 12:00 GMT 

PROGRAMME CONTENTS 

 Timecode Duration 

Opening Titles & Teasers 10:00:00 00’47” 

   

Cape Town Stadium Opening 10:00:47 07’01” 

  

Sting – Essential Africa 10:07:48 00’05” 

Braille Safari 10:07:53 04’12” 

  

Sting – On The Ball 10:12:05 00’05” 

Under-17 Tournament 10:12:10 05’35” 

  

Sting – City Guide: Polokwane 10:17:45 00’05” 

Polokwane City Guide 10:17:50 04’44” 

  

Sting – FIFA World Cup™ People 10:22:34 00’05” 

Freddy “Saddam” Maake 10:22:39 03’16” 

  

End Credits & Logo 10:25:55 00’26” 

END 10:26:21  

  
 



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 2 

TITLE:  

FEATURE – HEADLINES 
 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND 
 

COMMENTARY 

00:05 After wipe  Coming up, we’re in Cape Town, for the first official 

fixture at the city’s World Cup stadium. 

    
00:13 After wipe  From Western Cape to Mpumalanga, and a safari with 

a difference.   

    
00:20 After wipe  And, in Gauteng, we join youngsters from around the 

world at the Future Champions tournament. 

    
   END 

 
TITLE:  

FEATURE – CAPE TOWN STADIUM 
 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND 
 

COMMENTARY 

00:50 Three seconds in  In December, contractors handed over the keys to the 

Cape Town Stadium to SAIL STADEFRANCE, the 

operators of this impressive new facility. Situated 

between the iconic landmarks of Table Mountain and 

Robben Island, the stadium is fast becoming a tourist 

attraction in its own right.  

    
01:10 SOT: PIETER CRONJE 

(ENGLISH) 

2010 Spokesperson, 

City of Cape Town  

 

 THAT SETTING IS QUITE SUPERB, BUT IT WAS 

DESIGNED NOT ONLY TO BLEND IN WITH THAT 

UNIQUE EVIRONMENT BUT ALSO TO BE WORLD 

CLASS AND TO BE FUNCTIONAL AND TO BE 

MULTI-PURPOSE.  

    



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 3 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND  COMMENTARY 

01:23 After SOT  The decision to build such a significant structure in 

such a prominent position was not without risk or 

controversy.   

    
01:31 From c/a photographers  Now the Premier of Western Cape province, Helen Zille 

was the Mayor of Cape Town when plans for the 

stadium were still in their infancy.   

    
01:41 SOT: HELEN ZILLE 

(ENGLISH) 

 

Premier, Western Cape 

 

 IT WAS VERY DIFFICULT TO TAKE THE DECISION 

INITIALLY. THERE WAS A LOT OF RESISTANCE TO 

IT, A LOT OF OPPOSITION FROM VARIOUS 

QUARTERS - FROM PEOPLE WHO WERE SAYING 

WE WERE SPENDING THE MONEY INCORRECTLY 

TO PEOPLE WHO WERE SAYING YOU CAN’T PUT 

A STADIUM IN THIS BEAUTIFUL LOCATION, IT’LL 

BE TERRIBLE IN FRONT OF THE MOUNTAIN. AND I 

SPENT A LOT OF TIME PERSUADING PEOPLE TO  

    
   ACCEPT THE DECISION AND NOT TO GO TO 

COURT BECAUSE IF THEY’D GONE TO COURT IT 

WOULD HAVE BEEN DELAYED BEYOND THE 

DEADLINES TO COMPLETE THE STADIUM. SO I 

DID PUT MY POLITICAL CAREER ON THE LINE 

THERE AND I WAS VERY WORRIED ABOUT 

PUTTING A STADIUM IN THAT SPACE BECAUSE IT 

IS BETWEEN THE BEAUTIFUL SEA, ROBBEN 

ISLAND AND OUR ICONIC MOUNTAIN, AND IF 

YOU HAVE AN IMPERFECT ARCHITECTURAL 

STRUCTURE THERE IT WOULD HAVE BEEN A 

DISASTER.   

    



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 4 

 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND  COMMENTARY 

02:26 After SOT  The Premier’s powers of persuasion proved decisive 

and after a final game at the old Green Point Stadium 

between two local sides, Santos and Ajax Cape Town, 

that structure was demolished and a new one began 

to appear in its place.  As it did, local opinion began to 

swing in favour of the latest addition to the city’s 

skyline.  

    
02:46 VOX POP (ENGLISH) 

 

 AT THE BEGINNING, EVERYBODY WAS QUITE 

SCEPTICAL ABOUT THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE 

STADIUM. IT WAS TAKING UP VIEWS OF MOST OF 

THE RESIDENTS OF GREEN POINT, BUT TO BE 

HONEST, NOW THAT THE BIGGER PICTURE IS 

HERE, I THINK IT’S ABSOLUTELY AMAZING. 

    
03:03 VOX POP (ENGLISH) 

 

 IT’S A BEAUTIFUL DESIGN AND I THINK IT’S A 

BEAUTIFUL STADIUM AND IT’S SOMETHING THAT 

CAPE TOWN NEEDS. I HOPE THAT IN FUTURE IT 

WILL MAKE CAPE TOWN MONEY AND BRING ALL 

THE TOURISTS IN SO THAT WE CAN CREATE JOBS 

FOR EVERYONE. 

    
03:16 After SOT – stadium GVs  The public are pleased, and so, too, are the politicians, 

whose hard work has been rewarded. 

    
03:22 SOT: HELEN ZILLE 

(ENGLISH) 

 

Premier, Western Cape 

 AS IT TURNED OUT IT WAS A WORK OF ART. IT 

ENHANCED THE MOUNTAIN, IT ENHANCED THE 

SEA. IT MUST BE THE MOST BEAUTIFUL STADIUM 

IN THE MOST BEAUTIFUL LOCATION IN THE 

WORLD. 

    



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 5 

 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND  COMMENTARY 

03:34 After SOT – Zille & 

Jordaan pre-match 

 In January, Helen Zille joined Danny Jordaan and 

20,000 Capetonians for the opening fixture at the 

Cape Town Stadium, a friendly between those two 

local rivals, Santos and Ajax Cape Town.  

    
03:50 From interior stadium 

shots from stands 

 Only the lower tier of the stadium was open for this 

inaugural fixture, with the operators planning to move 

to full capacity over the next few months, ahead of the 

official handover to FIFA in May for the duration of the 

World Cup.  

    
04:07 From match action  With South Africa’s Premier Soccer League enjoying a 

short break during the Africa Cup of Nations, this was 

an opportunity for the two PSL sides to get in some 

valuable match practice.   

    
04:20 After Mexican wave  Unfortunately, the game lacked quality, not to 

mention goals in normal time, but the fans certainly 

seemed to enjoy the occasion. As for the stadium 

operators, they did admit to one or two teething 

troubles. 

    
04:37 SOT: MORNE DU 

PLESSIS (ENGLISH)   

 

Director, SAIL 

STADEFRANCE 

 WE WERE UNDERPREPARED FOR THE 

MAGNITUDE OF THE PRESS AND MEDIA 

INTEREST.  WE HAVE A LOCAL SOCCER MATCH 

TAKING PLACE HERE, WE’RE EXPECTING FIVE OF 

THE LOCAL NEWSPAPERS TO PITCH UP AND 500 

PITCHED UP FROM ALL OVER THE WORLD. WE 

WERE UNPREPARED FO THAT INTEREST AND THE 

ACCREDITATION SYSTEMS, PARKING, I KNOW 

THERE SOME TROUBLES IN THE PARKING ACCESS 

INTO THE STADIUM, SAFETY ISSUES ARE  



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 6 

 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND  COMMENTARY 

   DOUBLED, THEY’RE MAGNIFIED, IT’S SOMETHING 

WE’RE GOING TO GET USED TO BUT TO 

ACTUALLY GET A MATCH, 20,000 PEOPLE, WE’RE 

HAPPY WITH THE OVERALL RESULT, WE’RE 

GOING TO LEARN A LOT ABOUT THIS STADIUM 

FROM THIS. WE’LL HAVE A DEBRIEF, WE KNOW 

THERE’S ROOM FOR MAJOR IMPROVEMENT BUT 

THAT’S WHAT THESE WERE ABOUT, WE WEREN’T 

GOING TO BE PERFECT. 

    
05:33 After SOT  The game itself was decided by a penalty shoot-out, 

which required sudden death to separate the two 

teams. Bonginkosi Macala put Santos 6-5 ahead and 

when Shabalala’s effort was saved by Tshepo 

Motsoeneng, the Santos players celebrated a morale-

boosting victory over their Premier League rivals in this, 

the Cape Town Soccer Festival.   

    
06:01 From trophy celebs  A trophy for the winners, and for the stadium, nothing 

but praise from representatives of both teams. 

    
06:09 SOT: HANS VONK 

(ENGLISH) 

 

Ajax Cape Town 

 IT’S FANTASTIC! IT’S ABSOLUTELY STUNNING TO 

PLAY IN THIS STADIUM WHERE THE CROWD IS 

REALLY CLOSE TO THE FIELD. DRESSING ROOMS – 

FANTASTIC. FIELD, PITCH - COULD BE A LITTLE BIT 

SOFTER BUT THAT’S STILL YOUNG, SO IT NEEDS 

SOME TIME, BUT I THINK THIS STADIUM IS 

ABSOLUTELY READY FOR THE WORLD CUP. 

    



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 7 

 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND  COMMENTARY 

06:28 SOT: BOEBIE 

SOLOMONS (ENGLISH) 

 

Coach, Santos FC 

 I THINK THE FACILITIES ARE EXCELLENT. IT’S 

BEAUTIFUL, IT’S WORLD-CLASS, IT’S WELL LAID 

OUT, DRESSING ROOMS ARE BIG, IT’S 

COMFORTABLE, YOU KNOW, THERE’S A LOT OF 

SPACE AND IT’S DONE VERY PROFESSIONALLY. 

MAYBE A LITTLE MORE LIGHT IN THE DRESSING 

ROOM BECAUSE THE COLOURS ARE A LITTLE BIT 

DARK BUT MAYBE IT’S A LITTLE MORE 

SERVICEABLE WITH THE DARK COLOUR. 

    
06:52 After SOT - GVs stadium  The Cape Town Stadium will host eight matches 

during the FIFA World Cup™, beginning with France’s 

game against Uruguay on the opening day.  It will sign 

off its World Cup duties with the hosting of a semi-

final on July 6th, by which time Cape Town, and South 

Africa as a whole, will have achieved the ambitions 

shared by many in these parts, including Western 

Cape’s Premier.  

    
07:17 SOT: HELEN ZILLE 

(ENGLISH) 

Premier, Western Cape 

 

 IT’S AN OPPORTUNITY TO SHOW THE WORLD 

THAT AFRICA CAN GET IT RIGHT, THAT AFRICA IS 

A NEW EMERGING CONTINENT FULL OF PROMISE.  

IT GIVES US THE OPPORTUNITY TO DISPEL “AFRO-

PESSIMISM” AND TO SHOW THAT WE HAVE 

COMPETENCE, QUALITY, ABILITY IN BUILDING 

THIS NEW NATION. AND IF WE LEAVE THE 

LEGACY OF A NEW PERCEPTION ABOUT OUR 

CITY, ABOUT OUR PROVINCE AND ABOUT OUR 

COUNTRY, IT WILL BE RICH REWARD.   

    
07:48   END 

 



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 8 

TITLE:  

FEATURE – BRAILLE SAFARI 
 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND 
 

COMMENTARY 

07:54 From top - wildlife G/Vs  

 

 South Africa possesses a large variety of wildlife. From 

Limpopo Province in the north to Western Cape in the 

south, the country's national parks, nature and game 

reserves are home to hundreds of species of animals 

and birds alike. For zoologists, ornithologists and 

common-or-garden tourists, this is the place to be. 

    
08:17 On wildebeest 

 

 Since the end of apartheid and the establishment of 

democracy here, South Africa's tourist industry has 

flourished and now contributes ten per cent of the 

country's GDP.  The number of visitors has doubled 

since 1994 and the government continues to 

encourage entrepreneurs to expand their horizons. 

    
08:40 SOT: SERTORIO 

MSHOTHOLA  

(ENGLISH) 

Ntwanano Tours & 

Travel 

 

 MANY PEOPLE COME TO MPUMALANGA, THEY 

ONLY THINK OF THE KRUGER NATIONAL PARK.  

BUT, I THOUGHT, OKAY, WHY DON’T WE 

DIVERSIFY?  WHO IS TAKING CARE OF PEOPLE 

WITH DISABILITIES?  AND THEY SAID THIS IS THE 

TIME FOR US TO DO SOMETHING AS TOUR 

OPERATORS, TO CATER FOR PEOPLE WITH 

DISABILITIES. AND THAT’S HOW WE STARTED 

WITH THE BRAILLE TOUR. 

    
09:06 After SOT 

 

 Yes, Sertorio Mshothola and his team host visually-

impaired tourists on a "touch, feel and smell" 

experience. They can take a guided tour of the Kruger 

National Park and visit the Botanical Gardens in 

Nelspruit.  But the highlight is undoubtedly the Braille.   



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 9 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND 
 

COMMENTARY 

   Safari, which features a visit to an elephant retreat, 

where guests are given the opportunity to interact 

with these land mammals. 

    
09:29 SOT: PETER 

MAARTENS 

(AFRIKAANS) 

 

Braille Tourist 

 WHEN ANYBODY ENCOUNTERS THESE ANIMALS 

IN A GAME RESERVE, THEY TEND TO DO SO AT A 

DISTANCE. BUT HERE YOU CAN GET CLOSE TO 

THEM AND TOUCH THEM AND REALLY 

EXPERIENCE THE ANIMALS. WHAT AMAZED ME 

WAS HOW THICK HIS TRUNK WAS AND HOW 

SHARP THE TEETH WERE - YOU DON’T REALLY 

GET A SENSE OF THESE THINGS WHEN YOU 

ENCOUNTER THEM IN THE WILD. YOU DON’T 

REALLY APPRECIATE HOW BIG THEY ARE, AND I 

THINK THAT IS PROBABLY TRUE OF ANY ANIMAL, 

BE IT A LION OR A BABOON.   

    
10:05 After SOT - Elephant 

lying down  

 

 A native of Johannesburg, Mshothola was forced to 

leave South Africa after the 1976 Soweto uprising.  He 

lived and studied all over the world but dreamt of 

returning to a free South Africa to set up his own 

business.  He realised that ambition in the late 1990s 

and now takes pride in doing something he loves.  

And the elephants, it seems, are also having fun.

JIVENDAVA 

Elephant Handler 

(ENGLISH)

WHENEVER THEY SEE A STRANGER, OR WHEN 

OUR GUESTS COME, THEY ALSO WANT TO BE 

PART OF THE CONGREGATION, BECAUSE THAT’S 

WHEN THEY GET A LOT OF FOOD, PRAISES AND 

THINGS LIKE THAT.  THEY REALLY ENJOY BEING 

TOLD HOW GREAT THEY ARE.  WHEN YOU THEY

COMMENTARY 

   TOUCH THEM, THEY REALLY LIKE BEING

NATURAL AS WE CAN, IN CASE ONE DAY WHEN 

THEY WILL BE RELEASED BACK INTO THE BUSH 

THEY SHOULD BE ABLE TO LIVE LIKE ELEPHANTS.

his office 

 

 Mshothola’s business is based just outside Nelspruit, 

where four group games will be played in June. He 

currently employs eight people, including his wife, and

the FIFA World Cup™, when they see themselves 

providing a special service for fans from all over the 

world.

 So there you have it, an invite from an entrepreneur

Nation’s smallest province, Gauteng has Johannesburg 

and Pretoria within its borders – and the self-styled 

‘Gateway to 2010’ will play a key role in the shaping 

of this year’s event.

first truly international football tournament of this 

momentous year – the Gauteng Future Champions

 Formerly known as Pietersberg, Polokwane means 

“place of safety”, a city where everyone is 

welcome.  It’s also been branded the ‘City of Stars’ – 

not because you’re likely to encounter a famous face 

or two, but for the kind of treatment a visitor can 

expect to receive.

 Polokwane is situated in one of South Africa’s richest

Kruger, in close proximity, you certainly don’t have to 

travel far from the centre to experience the wildlife, 

which is both abundant and diverse.

 The bowl-like stadium is largely open to the elements 

but at least it’s sunshine rather than rain showers that

kilometres from the centre of Polokwane, the arena 

boasts an undulating roof which mimics the 

surrounding mountain range.  And that roof is 

supported by steel and concrete versions of the 

region’s native Baobab trees – linking the new stadium 

back to nature.

 And with the finishing touches almost complete, the 

stadium staged its first major test event in late January 

- the inaugural Peter Mokaba Cup, a four-team 

tournament featuring Supersport United, Kaizer 

Chiefs, Bidvest Wits and Danish club Brondby. And the 

official opening took place ahead of the final between 

the Chiefs, in yellow, and Supersport United.  In front 

of a crowd restricted to a little over 20,000, Kaizer 

Chiefs prevailed, although the city itself was the real 

winner as it continues the build-up to the big event.

UMID : ZB077646
Date de transcription : 02-DEC-18
Nom du modèle : fre-daily

Locuteur FS1 (0:00:14 > 0:00:40) [90%] : 
Espoir déçu pour les Suisses, pas de médaille à Vancouver, lors du super- G : Cuche Défago et compagnie n'ont pas réussi à monter sur le podium, la police bâloise a réalisé l'une des plus grosses saisies de cocaïne, de l'histoire en Suisse 70 kilos trouvés dans un container de Catherine Igor vous présente ses excuses pour son comportement le golfeur explique il suit une thérapie couvrait prennent et ses obsessions sexuelles.


Locuteur MS2 (0:00:44 > 0:00:52) [94%] : 
On attendait Didier Cuche, on attendait Didier Défago c'est le Norvégien Aksel Lund Svindal, qui est arrivé 1er du super- G à Whistler Mountain.


Locuteur FS2 (0:00:55 > 0:01:07) [95%] : 
2ème de ce super- G, l'Américain Bode Miller, médaille d'argent, a fait une course sans écart, il est resté 1er durant tout le début de la course en 3ème place l'Américain Andrew Weibrecht décroche la médaille de bronze.


Locuteur FS2 (0:01:09 > 0:01:21) [92%] : 
évidemment, c'est la déception pour l'équipe suisse, une équipe très attendu car Loubianka 8ème place devance Didier Cuche 10ème et Didier Défago 15ème place loin derrière son exploit en décembre.


Locuteur MS2 (0:01:22 > 0:01:32) [86%] : 
Mais l'émotion de la soirée, c'est cette chute terrible du Suédois Patrik Järbyn une très mauvaise chute, la course a dû être interrompu jusqu'à ce qu'ils soient évacués de l'API.


Locuteur FS4 (0:01:41 > 0:02:03) [93%] : 
La police de Bâle- Campagne à réaliser l'une des plus grandes saisies de cocaïne, de l'histoire en Suisse 70 kilos de poudre blanche placée dans 4 sacs de voyage chargé dans un container venant du Guatemala le parcours exact du container fait encore l'objet d'une enquête mais la cocaïne saisie n'était sans doute pas destinée au marché suisse.


Locuteur MS5 (0:02:04 > 0:02:15) [80%] : 
Il ne fera qu'sentir minime, nous pensons que personne ne l'attendait la drogue en Suisse, sinon le container auraient déjà été ouvert avant et la drogue aurait été retiré quant à branche un ce que porte ni trop grave.


Locuteur FS4 (0:02:15 > 0:02:20) [97%] : 
La valeur de la drogue sur le marché noir est évalué entre 7 et 8 millions de francs.


Locuteur MS6 (0:02:26 > 0:02:37) [93%] : 
Ricardo Lumengo apparaît bien seul pour présenter sa défense devant les médias, soupçonné d'avoir manipulé son élection au Conseil national, le parlementaire bernois réfute ces accusations.


Locuteur MS7 (0:02:37 > 0:02:57) [89%] : 
J'ai pas du tout de la fraude électorale, même si elle est les plan juridique ou même sur l'application des fêtes, il s'agissait tout simplement, j'ai pris, j'ai montré les gens comme moi, il fallait remplir leur bulletin, mais certaines ont ont utilisé la même fait et après ils ont mis des dents mais en signant l'air propre carte de légitimation.


Locuteur MS6 (0:02:57 > 0:03:08) [91%] : 
Les jours du conseiller national sont-ils comptés Ricardo Lumengo ne veut pas parler de démission dans l'immédiat, mais dans les faits, seuls ses plus proches, d'amis politiques lui affiche encore un soutien public.


Locuteur MS1 (0:03:08 > 0:03:09) [86%] : 
C'est quoi faire.


Locuteur MS5 (0:03:09 > 0:03:18) [91%] : 
Il a présenté ses excuses-moi, il garde toute ma confiance, c'est : il s'agit d'une centaine de bulletins je ne minimise pas les choses mais il a reconnu et il garde toute ma confiance en tant camarades.


Locuteur MS6 (0:03:19 > 0:03:46) [92%] : 
C'est ici que tout a commencé, nous sommes à Bienne dans les bureaux de l'ancien préfet s'est, lui, lorsqu'il était en fonction, qui a déposé plainte devant la justice, il avait découvert lors de l'élection au Conseil national, la même écriture sur plusieurs dizaines de bulletins, les conclusions du juge d'instruction était attendu en janvier mais Ricardo Lumengo a fait recours et demander des mesures suspend sa toi son avenir politique dépend de cette décision de justice.


Locuteur FS8 (0:03:50 > 0:04:03) [94%] : 
Pas de prison pour Julien Bogousslavsky, l'ancien neurologue du CHUV qui a détourné 5 millions de francs, des caisses de l'hôpital Vaudois écope finalement de 2 ans de prison avec sursis et de 180 jours- amende avec sursis.

Je suis content que les juges aient fait de la même par des choses que moi lors de l'examen, j'ai procédé enfin auxquelles j'ai procédé sur ce dossier, un point ne me satisfait pas, c'est le sursis qui est accordé aussi pour la peine pécuniaire de 108 ans de jours- amende à 1000 francs.


Locuteur FS8 (0:04:20 > 0:04:25) [95%] :

chapters.excerpt: * FRANCE, SUISSE : 20100219 et archives, certains collectionneurs d'art compulsifs recourent au vol pour assouvir leur passion.

* La Chaux-de-Fonds : 20100219 et archives, les amis du zoo du Bois du Petit-Château ont le projet d'un nouvel enclos de 300 mètres carrés pour le couple de loutres d'Asie Chico et Lula. Une souscription a été lancée auprès du public pour trouver des fonds pour la construction de cet enclos dans le jardin zoologique.
* Morges : 20100219, l'éducateur STERN Arno, fondateur de l'atelier d'expression libre "Closlieu", est venu animer l'atelier "Le jeu de peindre" de FAES Carole.

data.title: HOCKEY SLOVAQUIE - RUSSIE MESSIEURS - VANCOUVER 2010 - 10.02.19
data.summary: * Vancouver : 20100219, victoire de l'équipe nationale de Slovaquie de hockey sur glace, qui a battu la Russie sur le score de 2 buts à 1, lors d'un match du tour préliminaire de groupe B de hockey sur glace des Jeux olympiques d'hiver de Vancouver 2010.

data.title: SNOWBOARD HALFPIPE DAMES DEMI-FINALES - VANCOUVER 2010 - 10.02.19
data.summary: * Cypress Mountain : 20100218, victoire de la snowboardeuse australienne CRAWFORD Holly, qui a remporté la demi-finale de halfpipe en snowboard dames comptant pour les Jeux olympiques d'hiver de Vancouver 2010. Elle devance la Chinoise LIU Jiayu et la Canadienne NICOLL Mercedes. La seule Suissesse à se classer est HALLER Ursina, qui obtient la 6e place.

data.title: SOURCE (PAYS-BAS ET ARGENTINE) - 10.02.19
data.summary: * PAYS-BAS, ARGENTINE : 20100219 et archives, parcours des équipes nationale des Pays-Bas et de l'Argentine, dans la phase éliminatoire de la Coupe du monde de football 2010. L'Argentine jouera la Coupe du monde en Afrique du Sud dans le Groupe B tandis que les PAys-Bas joueront dans le Groupe E.
scripts:
2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 1 

ROAD TO THE 2010 FIFA WORLD CUP™ 

EPISODE 1 
Play-out: 19 February 2010; 14:00 GMT 

 

SCRIPT 
 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND COMMENTARY 

10:00:31 Stadium In 2010 Africa will host The FIFA World Cup™ – 

football’s greatest competition - for the first time.  

   
10:00:39 Owen goal 32 teams will go head to head in South Africa - 

they form the focus of this 16 part series – which 

reviews qualifying and previews the tournament 

itself. 

   
10:00:52 Penalty This is the playground of legends and football’s 

ultimate prize. 

   
10:01:03 World Cup Trophy 

rotations 

In this first programme we bring together two 

power-houses of the international game. 

   
10:01:09 Argentina iso Argentina and the Netherlands have been at the 

centre of many FIFA World Cup™ dramas over the 

years. The Dutch drew first blood in the 1974 

quarter-finals. 

   
10:01:24 1978 Argentina gained revenge in the final in Buenos 

Aires four years later on the way to their first title. 

   
10:01:34 1998 Dennis Bergkamp’s sublime injury time winner in 

the 1998 quarter final once again broke Argentine 

hearts. 

   
10:01:50 2006 And, last time around in Germany, 2006 the two 

teams drew 0-0 in the group stages. 



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 2 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND COMMENTARY 

10:02:01 Team line-ups In opposite sides of the draw in 2010, these 

football giants could, feasibly meet in the final 

once again.  

   
10:02:13 From top We begin with the Netherlands, placed in Group E 

along with Denmark, Japan and Cameroon. 

Despite never having won the title the Dutch will 

be one of the heavily backed teams in South Africa  

   
10:02:24 Fixtures Their campaign begins on 14th June against 

Denmark in Jo’burg’s Soccer City, they then move 

to Durban and Cape Town to complete their group 

matches.  

   
10:02:40 Netherlands v 

Argentina 2006 – 

teams out  

Perennial underachievers – beautiful football 

without the end product - a reputation for self-

destruction unparalleled in the international game 

– When will the Netherlands finally find some steel 

to underpin the silky football?  

   
10:03:09 Team line-up 

 

The latest crop of Dutch masters departed the 

2008 European Championship following a surprise 

defeat to Russia – before that, in the earlier 

rounds of the competition, the team played 

scintillating football. So, with just one major 

honour, the 1988 European Championship in the 

trophy cabinet, is it a cliché to say that Dutch 

football remains the embodiment of style over 

substance? 

   
10:03:39 SOT: BERT VAN 

MARWIJK 

(DUTCH)

chapters.excerpt: * Vancouver : 20100219, victoire du patineur américain LYSACEK Evan, qui a remporté le programme libre de patinage artistique des jeux olympiques d'hiver de Vancouver 2010. Il devance le Russe PLUSHENKO Evgueni et le Japonais TAKAHASHI Daisuke. Le Suisse LAMBIEL Stéphane doit se contenter de la 4e place après quelques erreurs sur les patins.
* Whistler : 20100219, réactions des skieurs suisses DEFAGO Didier et CUCHE Didier avant de s'élancer pour le Super-G en ski alpin des jeux olympiques d'hiver de Vancouver 2010.

* Berne-ville : 20100219, le conseiller national PS LUMENGO Ricardo fait l'objet d'une procédure pénale pour captation de suffrages. Le premier élu noir au Parlement fédéral est accusé de fraude électorale pour avoir récolté de manière irrégulière des voix lors de son élection au Grand Conseil bernois en 2006.

* Strasbourg, Interlaken : 20100219, les 47 Etats membres du Conseil de l'Europe ont adopté aujourd'hui à Interlaken une déclaration visant à améliorer le fonctionnement de la Cour européenne des droits de l'Homme (CDEH), recevant un nombre croissant de plaintes. La Suisse assume actuellement la présidence semestrielle tournante du Comité des ministres du Conseil de l'Europe.
* SUISSE : 20100219 et archives, la nouvelle carte d'assurance maladie LAMal avec puce électronique d'utilité pose certains problèmes d'utilisation et de confidentialité.
thematicCorporations: COUR EUROPÉENNE DES DROITS DE L'HOMME

chapters.excerpt: * Lausanne : 20100219 et archives, l'Etat de Vaud est opposé à la décision de la Ville de Lausanne d'offrir une formation professionnelle aux jeunes clandestins sans-papiers.
* Neuchâtel-ville : 20100219 et archives, le Conseil d'Etat neuchâtelois est en pleine crise politique.
* FRANCE : 20100219, 8 des 362 restaurants de la chaîne fast-food Quick ne vendent des hamburgers qu'avec de la viande halal, qui provient d'animaux abattus selon le rite musulman.

data.title: DIDIER BURKHALTER VOTATION 20100307 BAISSE TAUX CONVERSION 2E PILIER - 10.02.19
data.summary: * Berne-ville : 20100219, allocution télévisée du conseiller fédéral BURKHALTER Didier, qui a appelé à l'acceptation de la diminution du taux de conversion minimal 2e pilier. Cet objet concernant le financement de la prévoyance professionnelle est soumis en votation populaire fédérale le 20100307.
subTitles:
00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
     DANS QUELQUES INSTANTS, 
    ALLOCUTION DE D.BURKHALTER

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
{\an1}...

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
      -Chères concitoyennes,
        chers concitoyens.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
 L'enjeu de la votation du 7 mars 
sur le taux de conversion minimal..

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
        ..de la prévoyance
     professionnelle (LPP),..

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
         ..c'est d'assurer
    le "pacte des générations".

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
  Faire en sorte que le 2ème pilier
des assurances sociales reste solide.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
        Pour ne pas laisser
 un monde de dettes à nos enfants.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
 Sans responsabilité aujourd'hui,
 il n'y a pas de liberté demain.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
 Vous êtes peut-être très jeune, 
 appartenant à cette génération..

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
 ..qui risque de payer par la suite
les erreurs de notre système social.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
  Ou vous êtes peut-être salarié
et affilié à une caisse de pension.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
 Ou alors vous êtes indépendant..

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
..et vous cotisez à titre facultatif
      à une caisse de pension.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
       Ou vous faites partie
      des 950'000 retraités..

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
    ..qui reçoivent une rente 
    de leur caisse de pension.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
Les caisses de pension remplissent
  une fonction très importante.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
 Elles constituent le 2ème pilier
 de notre prévoyance vieillesse.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
 Le 1er pilier, l'AVS, et le 2ème
   pilier doivent rester forts.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
Le 2ème pilier est la plus importante
     de nos assurances sociales.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
     40 mias de francs par an.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
   3,7 mios d'actifs y cotisent.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
        Pour les retraités
      ou futurs retraités,..

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
         ..le 2ème pilier
joue un rôle plus grand que l'AVS.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
        Nous devons éviter
      de le mettre en péril.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
Le Conseil fédéral et le Parlement..

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
         ..vous proposent
     d'adapter aux réalités..

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
 ..les normes relatives au calcul
   des futures rentes versées.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
     Concrètement, il s'agit
  du taux de conversion minimal.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
La LPP est une assurance d'épargne.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
      Les assurés constituent
     un avoir de vieillesse,..

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
     ..au moyen de cotisations
  sur leur salaire et d'intérêts.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
    A la retraite, l'avoir est
soit versé sous forme de capital,..

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
    ..soit transformé en rente.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
        En cas de rente,..

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
     ..son montant est calculé
  au moyen du taux de conversion.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
  Le taux de conversion minimal..

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
  ..détermine le montant minimal
      de la rente à verser.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
    Il dépend de deux facteurs.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
  D'une part, l'espérance de vie.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
    D'autre part, le rendement
     que l'avoir économisé..

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
     ..pourra encore produire 
    jusqu'à l'ultime versement.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
Le taux appliqué aujourd'hui se base
 sur des hypothèses plus valables.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
 Nous vivons plus longtemps, ce qui
pose problème aux caisses de pension.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
             Un homme
 qui part à la retraite en 2015..

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
          ..vivra encore
    en moyenne plus de 20 ans.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
        Le capital épargné
    doit durer plus longtemps.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
  La rente doit aussi être versée
  plus longtemps aux survivants.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
          Autre tendance:
   les rendements des capitaux..

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
   ..sont moins bons aujourd'hui
         que par le passé.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
  Seule une spéculation risquée..

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
      ..pourrait à la rigueur
produire de meilleures performances.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
Nous devons être sûrs que l'argent
   des rentes est bien placé..

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
      ..et non joué en Bourse
         comme au casino.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
   Espérance de vie plus longue
   et rendements insuffisants.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
      Les caisses de pension
      doivent donc diviser..

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
..en un plus grand nombre de portions
         le capital épargné.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
  Mais le capital reste le même,
   personne ne nous vole rien.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
        Ceux qui touchent
   déjà une rente aujourd'hui..

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
     ..ne sont pas concernés..

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
        ..par l'adaptation
  du taux de conversion minimal.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
Ce taux est appliqué à la retraite
        et ne change plus.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
    Le vrai danger ne vient pas
      de la baisse du taux,..

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
     ..mais du taux trop élevé
       appliqué aujourd'hui.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
Les caisses de pension doivent payer
des rentes qui ne sont pas financées.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
          Elles utilisent
   l'argent des assurés actifs..

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
..pour verser les rentes en cours.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
 Ou alors, elles doivent augmenter
     le taux des cotisations.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
       Promettre des rentes
     trop élevées a son prix.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
Les assurés devront soit contribuer 
à l'assainissement de leur caisse,..

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
     ..soit verser durablement
   des cotisations trop élevées.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
  Dans les deux cas, ça signifie
  des charges supplémentaires..

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
 ..au détriment des jeunes actifs.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
   Ce serait donc une injustice 
   et cela nuirait à l'économie.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
 Le 2ème pilier est indispensable
      aux personnes âgées,..

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
  ..mais il ne doit pas affaiblir
        les jeunes actifs.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
    Je vous prie de dire OUI..

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
         ..à l'adaptation
  du taux de conversion minimal.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
 Pour que les caisses de pension 
ne soient pas mises en difficulté.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
      Pour que le 2ème pilier
     demeure fort à l'avenir..

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
     ..et que l'on maintienne
  un vrai pacte des générations.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
         Je vous remercie.

00:00:00:00  00:00:00:00
 SOUS-TITRAGE SWISS TXT 1211 GENEVE 8
Infos TXT 776 et www.sous-titrage.ch

chapters.excerpt: * Whistler : 20100218, victoire de la skieuse allemande RIESCH Maria dans le super-combiné dames des Jeux olympiques d'hiver de Vancouver 2010. Elle s'impose devant l'Américaine MANCUSO Julia et la Suédoise PAERSON Anja. L'Américaine VONN Lindsey, 1ère à l'issue de la descente a chuté lors du slalom du super-combiné.
